findings.title: RTS - Reward Token Sanitisation
findings.description: The contract processes variables without proper sanitization and checking, potentially leading to vulnerability issues. The reward token should not be allowed to be the native token address.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if the `swapThreshold` variable is set to a big number, it may trigger a huge token swap, leading to significant price volatility due to the token's highly volatile price.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions, but these variables are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which also decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L12 - Using Variables before Declaration
findings.description: The contract is using a variable before the declaration.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables that have been configured on user-supplied input without proper check for the case where a value is zero, leading to problems when the contract is executed.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.

findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop the buys and transfers. The owner may take advantage of it by setting the `_maxWalletToken` to zero.

findings.title: ULTW - Transfers Liquidity to Team Wallet
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to transfer funds without limit to the team wallet, which can lead to exploitation by setting the `totalFee` to zero.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The `ownerLeaded` role has the authority to stop addresses from transactions and may take advantage of it by calling the `devListAddress` function.
